RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduado em Processamento de Dados pela Universidade Federal do Amazonas (1991). Especialização em Ciência da Computação pela Universidade Federal do Amazonas/IBM Brasil (1992). Mestre em Ciência da Computação pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (1996). Doutor em Ciência da Computação pela Universidade Federal de Minas Gerais (2009). Professor Associado da Universidade Federal do Amazonas. Ocupou o cargo de Diretor do Instituto de Computação da Universidade Federal do Amazonas -IComp/UFAM(2011-2017). Atua na área de Ciência da Computação, com ênfase em Aprendizagem de Máquina, Sistemas Formais, Sistemas Operacionais, Sistemas Reativos, Sistemas Embarcados, Sistemas de Tempo Real e Low Power, Sistemas Cyber-Físicos, Geração Automática de Código e Verificação de Sistemas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelors degree in Data Processing at Federal University of Amazonas (1991). Specialization in Computer Science at Federal University of Amazonas / IBM Brasil (1992). Master in Computer Science at Federal University of Minas Gerais (1996). Ph.D. in Computer Science at Federal University of Minas Gerais (2009). Associate Professor at the Federal University of Amazonas. Has was Director of the Institute of Computing of the Federal University of Amazonas - ICOMP / UFAM (2011-2017). Works on Computer Science Area, with emphasis on Machine Learning, Formal Systems, Operating Systems, Reactive Systems, Embedded Systems, Real-Time and Low Power Systems, Cyber ​​Systems, Automatic Code Generation, and Systems Verification.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Ifip International Conference On Very Large Scale Integration Systems Vlsi Soc

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We proposed an architecture that enabled designers to consider the full range of power consumption trade-offs at application level by designing a reconfigurable sensor node that operates both in low power with low performance and at high performance, and thus consuming higher power.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Low Power/High Performance Self-Adapting Sensor Node Architecture
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Low Power/High Performance Self-Adapting Sensor Node Architecture

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Low Power/High Performance Self-Adapting Sensor Node Architecture

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper we propose a new reconfigurable architecture for sensor nodes, called RANS-300, which can operate in applications demanding low power to high performance, although sacrificing the lifetime of the sensor node. This node has a FPGA board, which can be dynamically reconfigured to add new configuration, and has a CompactFlash device to expand the node possibilities.
